content: अर्ह् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> [अर्हति, अर्हितुं, आनर्ह, अर्हित] (epic <ab>A.</ab> as रावणो नार्हते पूजां <ls>Rām.</ls>) {@--1@} To deserve, merit, be worthy of (with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>inf.</ab>); किमिव नायुष्मानमरेश्वरान्नार्हति <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; so दंडं, प्रायश्चित्तं, वधं &c. {@--2@} To have a right to, be entitled to, be allowed to do any thing (with <ab>acc.</ab>); ननु गर्भः पित्र्यं रिक्थमर्हति <ls>Ś. 6</ls>; न स्त्री स्वातंत्र्यमर्हति <ls>Ms. 9. 3</ls>; also with <ab>inf.</ab>; न स तल्लब्धुमर्हति <ls>Ms. 8. 147</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">11. 7</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 11.">18.</ls> {@--3@} To be obliged or required to do a thing, <ab>oft.</ab> implying duty or obligation; नान्यत्स्त्री दातुमर्हति <ls>Y. 2. 49</ls>; इमां प्रसादयितुमर्हसि <ls>R. 1. 88.</ls> {@--4@} To be fit or deserve to be done; अर्थना मयि भवद्भिः कर्तुमर्हति <ls>N. 5. 112</ls>; <ls>Dk. 137.</ls> {@--5@} To be equal to; be worth, न ते गात्राण्युपचारमर्हंति <ls>Ś. 3. 18</ls> are not equal to; सर्वे ते जपयज्ञस्य कलां नार्हंति षोडशीं <ls>Ms. 2. 86</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">3. 131.</ls> {@--6@} To be able, translateable by ‘can’; न मे वचनमन्यथा भवितुमर्हति <ls>Ś. 4</ls>; विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति <ls>Bg. 2. 17</ls>; अनुद्योगेन तैलानि तिलेभ्यो नाप्तुमर्हति <ls>H. Pr. 30</ls> cannot get. {@--7@} To worship, honour; see {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} below. {@--8@} (Used with <ab>inf.</ab> in the second <ab>pers.</ab> and sometimes in the third) अर्ह् represents a mild form of command, advice or courteous request, and may be translated by ‘pray’, ‘deign’, ‘be pleased to’, ‘will be pleased to’; द्वित्राण्यहान्यर्हसि सोढुमर्हन् <ls>R. 5. 25</ls> pray wait &c; नार्हसि मे प्रणयं विहंतुं <ls n="R.">2. 58</ls>; तं संतः श्रोतुमर्हंति <ls n="R.">1. 10</ls> will be pleased or be good enough to listen to it; <ls>Ku. 6. 32</ls>; <ls>Ms. 1. 2</ls>; <ls>Bg. 10. 16</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">2. 17</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 72</ls>; <ls n="R.">1. 88</ls>; <ls n="R.">3. 46.</ls> {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} or {c10c} <ab>P.</ab> To honour, worship; राजार्जिहत्तं मधुपर्कपाणिः <ls>Bk. 1. 17</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 3</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 3.">119.</ls>
